column4: hey guys does anyonen know how to get a HP multimedia keyboard to work... so i can control the volume and stuff?... maybe get onscreen graphics too when i do so
There was a package i found once. Look in Synaptic for hotkeys
Something to do with hotkeys, and not the one that comes with ubuntu
Let me look
Is Hotkey-setup already installed?
Ok, because hotkeys-setup comes bundled with Ubuntu, IIRC.
If you already have the first one, then yes.
Are you on Gnome or KDE?
Ok, yeah. When I was using Kubuntu, I had to get the Hotkeys scripts
Do you have hotkey-setup already?
Yeah, go for the other one
Both
and should work once installed?
May take some minimal configuring.
It should have man pages though. I can try, but it's been a while.
can u help me configure the hotkeys
I can try.
Try going in to terminal, do "man hotkeys". That should give you some info about it
Also, there should be a directory, either /etc/default/hotkeys, /etc/hotkeys, /usr/share/hotkeys, something like that
This will have all the configuration files, as well as keyboard definitions
There's a config file where you set all the commands for it
It might be /etc/Hotkeys?
Nope, that's why we're doing it with the hotkeys package ;)
